shortdesc.ph: Adjusts the volume of the loopback audio signal.
Adjusts the volume of the signal captured by the sound card.
Adjusts the volume of the signal captured by the sound card.

section.p: After calling to enable loopback recording, you can call this method to adjust the volume of the loopback signal.
After calling to enable sound card capture, you can call this method to adjust the volume of the signal captured by the sound card.
After calling to enable sound card capture, you can call this method to adjust the volume of the captured signal.

plentry.pd: The volume of the music file, ranging from 0 to 100. 100 (default) represents the original volume of the file.
The volume of the music file. The range is 0~100. 100 (default) represents the original volume of the file.
Volume range of the music file is 0~100. 100 (default) represents the original file volume.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p:
When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
